2017/KER/49552
B. SUDHEENDRA KUMAR, J.
Cri.M.C. No.5228 of 2013
Dated this the 7 day of December, 2017
ORDER

When this matter has been taken up for hearing, the
learned counsel for the petitioner has sought for
permission to withdraw this Crl.M.C. Permission stands
granted. Accordingly, this Crl.M.C. stands dismissed as
withdrawn.

2. The learned counsel for the petitioner has
submitted that the second accused in this case, namely,
Naeem Ibrahim, who is the brother of the petitioner
herein, had deposited an amount equivalent to the cheque
amount before the court below at the time of executing
the bond. The learned counsel has further submitted that
the second accused is prepared to file an affidavit before
the court below stating that he has no objection in
releasing the above said amount to theâ€™ second
respondent herein, who is the complainant before the
court below. The learned counsel for the second

na
2017/KER/49552
Cri.M.C. No.5228 of 2013
-:2%-
respondent herein has submitted that if the above said
amount is released to the second respondent, he is
prepared to withdraw the complaint.

3. This being the situation, it is directed that if the
second accused in this case files affidavit before the court
below, within 15 days of receipt of this order stating that
he has no objection in releasing the amount deposited by
him in favour of the complainant, the court below shall
release the said amount to the complainant, if the
complainant is prepared to withdraw the complaint on
receipt of the said amount.

| make it clear that the personal attendance of the
petitioner or the second accused shall not be insisted
upon by the court below for the above purpose.

Sd/-
B. SUDHEENDRA KUMAR,
JUDGE
